intro: Xanthophyllum ramiflorum, commonly known as the golden-flowered broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, drought-tolerant plants.
